Name: Bronze statuette of the goddess Isis nursing Horus
Description: A sitting bronze statuette of the goddess Isis nursing her son Horus sitting on her knees. The goddess wears a crown composed of bovine horns and the solar disk, and a uraeus rendered in relief on her forehead. The child Horus wears the tress, a symbol of childhood, on the right side of his head, and also wears the uraeus on his forehead. The feet of the goddess rest on a hollow trapezoidal base with a tenon at the center.
